column4: I am trying to move a file to my root directory and im having problems, can someone give me a hand please?
it is in your home folder?
so mv that to the dest
show me exactly what you typed
and do pwd to see what dir you are in..
ls will tell you what is in your current working dir..
nope the way you wrote it you could be in any dir because it uses the full path to the file.
you could do that as well
mv also renames, so do mv ventrilo_sr ventrilo_srv
yup that happens when you are noy in /home
it changes the owner and the group of the file
